physical_appearance:This print is a pictorial of a man who dons a conical hat and is holding on to a wooden oar whilst looking afar. Out of focus and in the background to his left stands a woman. Yellowing has occurred along the edges of the print
 and brown spotting can also be found on the backing that the print is mounted on.  On the verso
 there is the artist\u0027s photographer studio chop
 as well as the number and title of the work.

sgcool_label_text:Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. This photograph was part of a set of 12 prints sent to the Royal Photographic Society in 1956.

metadata.physical_appearance: This print is a pictorial of a man who dons a conical hat and is holding on to a wooden oar whilst looking afar. Out of focus and in the background to his left stands a woman. Yellowing has occurred along the edges of the print, and brown spotting can also be found on the backing that the print is mounted on.  On the verso, there is the artist's photographer studio chop, as well as the number and title of the work.
